meanings.definition: To find fault with or reproach severely; censure
meanings.sent1: She upbraided her friend for being late to the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher upbraided the student for not completing the homework.
meanings.sent3: The mother upbraided her child for eating all the cookies before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The coach upbraided the team for their lack of effort during the game.
meanings.sent5: The boss upbraided the employee for making a costly mistake.

meanings.sent1: He upbraided his brother for breaking his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The manager upbraided the employee for constantly being late to work.
meanings.sent3: The chef upbraided the apprentice for burning the souffle.
meanings.sent4: The principal upbraided the students for their disrespectful behavior in the cafeteria.
meanings.sent5: The customer upbraided the waiter for bringing the wrong order.
